Package it.polimi.ingsw.network.server.communication.socket

Class SocketClientHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.ingsw.network.server.communication.socket.SocketClientHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    public class SocketClientHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    A SocketClientHandler serves the purpose of interfacing with a specific client-side application through a Socket communication protocol. Virtually a SocketClientHandler intercepts all the NetworkMessages sent from the client-side application and forwards them to the CommunicationHub; they are then interpreted decisions can be made according to the message content.

    To achieve this goal a bi-directional channel is needed in order to make the communication possible. At the beginning of the communication process an ObjectOutputStream is created to send NetworkMessage to the remote client-side application. An ObjectInputStream is then created to allow messages to be received.

    Before the communication can end, a call to closeConnection() must be performed in order to safely interrupt the connection and notify the client-side application in the proper way.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private CommunicationHub communicationHub
      The CommunicationHub instance to which messages will be forwarded.
      private java.io.ObjectInputStream in
      The input channel used to receive NetworkMessage from the client-side application.
      private java.io.ObjectOutputStream out
      The output channel used to send NetworkMessage to the client-side application.
      private java.net.Socket socket
      The Socket reference used to instantiate the bi-directional communication to the client-side application.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      SocketClientHandler​(java.net.Socket socket)
      This is the only constructor used to create a new SocketClientHandler with the given socket argument.

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      private void closeConnection()
      Safely closes all the opened connections.
      void run()
      Executes the SocketClientHandler core logic: forwards every NetworkMessage received from the client-side application to the CommunicationHub for proper handling until an MessageType.UNREGISTER_REQUEST type of NetworkMessage is received or if any exception is throw at a lower level.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • communicationHub

        The CommunicationHub instance to which messages will be forwarded.

      • socket

        The Socket reference used to instantiate the bi-directional communication to the client-side application.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SocketClientHandler

        public SocketClientHandler​(java.net.Socket socket)
        This is the only constructor used to create a new SocketClientHandler with the given socket argument. This is used to create the input and output channels to instantiate a bi-directional communication to the client-side application.
        Parameters:
        socket - the Socket object needed to instantiate the bi-directional communication.

    • Method Detail

      • closeConnection

        private void closeConnection()
        Safely closes all the opened connections. This method should be called only when the communication is terminated and no more NetworkMessage are desired to be sent and/or received, or if an unexpected behavior has occurred and a safe way to truncate the communication to the client-side application is needed.

      • run

        public void run()
        Executes the SocketClientHandler core logic: forwards every NetworkMessage received from the client-side application to the CommunicationHub for proper handling until an MessageType.UNREGISTER_REQUEST type of NetworkMessage is received or if any exception is throw at a lower level. Finally a closeConnection() call is performed to safely close the communication before terminating.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
